snippet: The horrors of PTSD are more complex than most of us know. Sufferers feel exile, and healing must be moral as well as psychological.
abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column praises David J Morris book The Evil Hours for way it examines post-traumatic stress disorder through lens of history, psychology and literature, making it accessible for those who have no experience with it; suggests book is part of broader reevaluation about condition that is shifting perception of it to kind of moral exile, which offers new options for its treatment.
lead_paragraph: The horrors of PTSD are more complex than most of us know. Sufferers feel exile, and healing must be moral as well as psychological.
